page.title: 01SOMERSHAM INTRODUCTION
page.content: SOMERSHAM DOMINATES THE SURVEY AREA SITUATED 5 MILES NE OF ST.IVES (CAMBS) AND 15 MILES NW OF CAMBRIDGE. SOMERSHAM WAS MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK, AND NOW CONTAINS AN OLDER PART CENTRED ON THE CURVED HIGH STREET WITH NUMEROUS SHOPS, OVERLOOKED BY THE C13TH PARISH CHURCH. SIX NEWER ESTATES (ONE UNDER CONSTRUCTION) AND A NUMBER OF NEWER NON-ESTATE DWELLINGS, HAVE INCREASED THE POPULATION FROM APPROX 1500 TO APPROX 3500, OVER THE LAST 25 YEARS. SOMERSHAM IS SITUATED ON THE FENLAND EDGE, FLAT LAND OVER WHICH STRONG WINDS OFTEN BLOW AND WHERE DELIGHTFUL SUNSETS CAN BE VIEWED. SITUATED AMONGST ARABLE LAND WITH MANY ORCHARDS, SOMERSHAM NOW CATERS A GOOD DEAL FOR PEOPLE WORKING IN NEARBY TOWNS AND MANY SERVICE PERSONNEL FROM NEARBY RAF AND USAF STATIONS.
